segment.source: Configure Windows 10 Mobile using Lockdown XML (Windows 10)
segment.target: Configure Windows 10 Mobile using Lockdown XML (Windows 10)

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile allows enterprises to lock down a device, define multiple user roles, and configure custom layouts on a device.
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile allows enterprises to lock down a device, define multiple user roles, and configure custom layouts on a device.

segment.source: Configure Windows 10 Mobile using Lockdown XML
segment.target: Configure Windows 10 Mobile using Lockdown XML

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile allows enterprises to lock down a device, define multiple user roles, and configure custom layouts on a device.
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile allows enterprises to lock down a device, define multiple user roles, and configure custom layouts on a device.

segment.source: For example, the enterprise can lock down a device so that only applications and settings in an allow list are available.
segment.target: For example, the enterprise can lock down a device so that only applications and settings in an allow list are available.

segment.source: This topic provides example XML that you can use in your own lockdown XML file that can be included in a provisioning package or when using a mobile device management (MDM) solution to push lockdown settings to enrolled devices.
segment.target: This topic provides example XML that you can use in your own lockdown XML file that can be included in a provisioning package or when using a mobile device management (MDM) solution to push lockdown settings to enrolled devices.

segment.source: After you apply the lockdown settings, the lockdown configuration is stored in a wehlockdown.xml file on the device.
segment.target: After you apply the lockdown settings, the lockdown configuration is stored in a wehlockdown.xml file on the device.

segment.source: For details on each of the configuration items, see the AssignedAccess/AssignedAccessXml section of the EnterpriseAssignedAccess configuration service provider (CSP) reference.
segment.target: For details on each of the configuration items, see the AssignedAccess/AssignedAccessXml section of the EnterpriseAssignedAccess configuration service provider (CSP) reference.

segment.source: Order of lockdown settings
segment.target: Order of lockdown settings

segment.source: The configuration items must be in the following order when you lock down settings:
segment.target: The configuration items must be in the following order when you lock down settings:

segment.source: Configuring multiple app packages
segment.target: Configuring multiple app packages

segment.source: Multiple app packages enable multiple apps to exist inside the same package.
segment.target: Multiple app packages enable multiple apps to exist inside the same package.

segment.source: Since product IDs identify packages and not applications, specifying a product ID is not enough to distinguish between individual apps inside a multiple app package.
segment.target: Since product IDs identify packages and not applications, specifying a product ID is not enough to distinguish between individual apps inside a multiple app package.

segment.source: Trying to pin application tiles from a multiple app package with just a product ID can result in unexpected behavior.
segment.target: Trying to pin application tiles from a multiple app package with just a product ID can result in unexpected behavior.

segment.source: To support pinning applications in multiple app packages, an AUMID parameter can be specified in lockdown.xml.
segment.target: To support pinning applications in multiple app packages, an AUMID parameter can be specified in lockdown.xml.

segment.source: The following example shows how to pin both Outlook Mail and Outlook Calendar:
segment.target: The following example shows how to pin both Outlook Mail and Outlook Calendar:

segment.source: Lockdown example to use in a lockdown XML file
segment.target: Lockdown example to use in a lockdown XML file

segment.source: The XML example can be used as a lockdown file that is contained in a provisioning package created in Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD).
segment.target: The XML example can be used as a lockdown file that is contained in a provisioning package created in Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD).

segment.source: However, if you use MDM to push the lockdown file directly to devices, the XML example must use escaped characters for lockdown (such as in place of ) as a result of XML embedded in XML.
segment.target: However, if you use MDM to push the lockdown file directly to devices, the XML example must use escaped characters for lockdown (such as in place of ) as a result of XML embedded in XML.

segment.source: You can easily find an online escape tool to help you with this process.
segment.target: You can easily find an online escape tool to help you with this process.

segment.source: Add lockdown XML to a provisioning package
segment.target: Add lockdown XML to a provisioning package

segment.source: Use the Windows ICD tool included in the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (ADK) for Windows 10 to create a provisioning package.
segment.target: Use the Windows ICD tool included in the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (ADK) for Windows 10 to create a provisioning package.

segment.source: Install the ADK.
segment.target: Install the ADK.

segment.source: Follow the instructions at Build and apply a provisioning package to create a project, selecting Common to all Windows mobile editions for your project.
segment.target: Follow the instructions at Build and apply a provisioning package to create a project, selecting Common to all Windows mobile editions for your project.

segment.source: In Available customizations, go to Runtime settingsEmbeddedLockdownProfilesAssignedAccessXml.
segment.target: In Available customizations, go to Runtime settingsEmbeddedLockdownProfilesAssignedAccessXml.

segment.source: In the center pane, click Browse to locate and select the lockdown XML file that you created.
segment.target: In the center pane, click Browse to locate and select the lockdown XML file that you created.

segment.source: browse button
segment.target: browse button

segment.source: On the File menu, select Save.
segment.target: On the File menu, select Save.

segment.source: On the Export menu, select Provisioning package.
segment.target: On the Export menu, select Provisioning package.

segment.source: Change Owner to IT Admin, which will set the precedence of this provisioning package higher than provisioning packages applied to this device from other sources, and then select Next.
segment.target: Change Owner to IT Admin, which will set the precedence of this provisioning package higher than provisioning packages applied to this device from other sources, and then select Next.

segment.source: Optional.
segment.target: Optional.

segment.source: In the Provisioning package security window, you can choose to encrypt the package and enable package signing.
segment.target: In the Provisioning package security window, you can choose to encrypt the package and enable package signing.

segment.source: Enable package encryption - If you select this option, an auto-generated password will be shown on the screen.
segment.target: Enable package encryption - If you select this option, an auto-generated password will be shown on the screen.

segment.source: Enable package signing - If you select this option, you must select a valid certificate to use for signing the package.
segment.target: Enable package signing - If you select this option, you must select a valid certificate to use for signing the package.

segment.source: You can specify the certificate by clicking Select and choosing the certificate you want to use to sign the package.
segment.target: You can specify the certificate by clicking Select and choosing the certificate you want to use to sign the package.

segment.source: Click Next to specify the output location where you want the provisioning package to go when it's built.
segment.target: Click Next to specify the output location where you want the provisioning package to go when it's built.

segment.source: By default, Windows ICD uses the project folder as the output location.
segment.target: By default, Windows ICD uses the project folder as the output location.

segment.source: Optionally, you can click Browse to change the default output location.
segment.target: Optionally, you can click Browse to change the default output location.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: Click Build to start building the package.
segment.target: Click Build to start building the package.

segment.source: The provisioning package doesn't take long to build.
segment.target: The provisioning package doesn't take long to build.

segment.source: The project information is displayed in the build page and the progress bar indicates the build status.
segment.target: The project information is displayed in the build page and the progress bar indicates the build status.

segment.source: If you need to cancel the build, click Cancel.
segment.target: If you need to cancel the build, click Cancel.

segment.source: This cancels the current build process, closes the wizard, and takes you back to the Customizations Page.
segment.target: This cancels the current build process, closes the wizard, and takes you back to the Customizations Page.

segment.source: If your build fails, an error message will show up that includes a link to the project folder.
segment.target: If your build fails, an error message will show up that includes a link to the project folder.

segment.source: You can scan the logs to determine what caused the error.
segment.target: You can scan the logs to determine what caused the error.

segment.source: Once you fix the issue, try building the package again.
segment.target: Once you fix the issue, try building the package again.

segment.source: If your build is successful, the name of the provisioning package, output directory, and project directory will be shown.
segment.target: If your build is successful, the name of the provisioning package, output directory, and project directory will be shown.

segment.source: If you choose, you can build the provisioning package again and pick a different path for the output package.
segment.target: If you choose, you can build the provisioning package again and pick a different path for the output package.

segment.source: To do this, click Back to change the output package name and path, and then click Next to start another build.
segment.target: To do this, click Back to change the output package name and path, and then click Next to start another build.

segment.source: If you are done, click Finish to close the wizard and go back to the Customizations Page.
segment.target: If you are done, click Finish to close the wizard and go back to the Customizations Page.

segment.source: After you build the provisioning package, follow the instructions for applying a provisioning package at runtime to Windows 10 Mobile.
segment.target: After you build the provisioning package, follow the instructions for applying a provisioning package at runtime to Windows 10 Mobile.

segment.source: Push lockdown XML using MDM
segment.target: Push lockdown XML using MDM

segment.source: After you deploy your devices, you can still configure lockdown settings through your MDM solution if it supports the EnterpriseAssignedAccess CSP.
segment.target: After you deploy your devices, you can still configure lockdown settings through your MDM solution if it supports the EnterpriseAssignedAccess CSP.

segment.source: To push lockdown settings to enrolled devices, use the AssignedAccessXML setting and use the lockdown XML as the value.
segment.target: To push lockdown settings to enrolled devices, use the AssignedAccessXML setting and use the lockdown XML as the value.

segment.source: The lockdown XML will be in a HandheldLockdown section that becomes XML embedded in XML, so the XML that you enter must use escaped characters (such as in place of ).
segment.target: The lockdown XML will be in a HandheldLockdown section that becomes XML embedded in XML, so the XML that you enter must use escaped characters (such as in place of ).

segment.source: After the MDM provider pushes your lockdown settings to the device, the CSP processes the file and updates the device.
segment.target: After the MDM provider pushes your lockdown settings to the device, the CSP processes the file and updates the device.

segment.source: Learn more
segment.target: Learn more

segment.source: Customizing Your Device Experience with Assigned Access
segment.target: Customizing Your Device Experience with Assigned Access
